exposition: 'When the roots are deep there is no reason to fear the wind.' -African Proverb
conversation: N: A new soul pops into existence; Sapling.
N: Across the way, an old soul resides; Oak.
N: Behind them stands a strong tree, a symbol of their connection.
N: How far do the roots go?
S: What the hell are you?
O: This is the hill; you have died.
S: What do you mean, died?
O: If you’re here, you’re dead; it’s the way of this place.
S: What type of optical illusion is this...
S: There’s no way I’m dead.
O: Don’t worry, you’ll remember your life soon enough.
O: Allow yourself to realize the truth.
N: A light breeze manifests, ruffling the leaves.
N: Sapling’s passing has just begun;
N: It will get worse before it gets better.
